revised_title: Jean Baptiste Perrin: A Pioneering Physicist and Educator
tldr: Jean Baptiste Perrin was a renowned physicist who made significant contributions to the understanding of atomic physics, cathode rays, and Brownian motion. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1926 for his work on Brownian motion, which helped confirm the existence of atoms. Perrin was also an educator and advocate for scientific research, encouraging students and supporting the development of scientific opportunities in France.
